comment: Zoller is a very sweet prof. I'd reccomend her class to anyone. She spends most of the class time lecturing through a powerpoint which she posts, so it's easy to follow along. Plus, there are class discussions about primary source material. She knows her stuff; if you're interested in the course subject, highly reccomend taking her.
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She is understanding and lenient on deadlines. As long as you email her before it's due, you have an extension. However, she does grade harshly. As someone who has always made an A she has put me to work. Her rubrics throw me really off and her papers are Chicago style. There is (what to me feels like) busy work but it's not hard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: I took History 1112 as a 7-week course and compared to my previous 7-week courses this one had an absurd amount of work. I understand trying to cram in work during the short time but most of it felt unnecessary. There were 3 essays (Chicago style not MLA),weekly discussion posts (and responces) weekly quizzes, and LOTS of reading. I don't reccomend
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: Lots. Of. Writing. This class improved my writing more than my English classes. She is a tough grader when it comes to essays and even discussion posts and replies. Everything you write must be interesting and thought provoking. A lot of work for a 7 week course but it's understandable, it was just a lot with the grading criteria. Reading is key!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Took Silke for 7 week online course. She is a good professor who cares a lot about her students and she is lenient with extensions on work. Very time consuming workload but it is manageable with good work ethic, she allows you to work ahead. 3 papers and 13 modules with a quiz, writing assignment, and discussion board in each. Textbook is necessary
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: One of the hardest online courses I've taken and it shouldn't be. She grades very harshly and her assignments take too much time. If you like to read it might be a good class for you but make sure your writing skills are expert level if you want an A even for the discussion posts. It is ridiculously hard to get an A on any assignment.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! SHE IS EXTREMELY NITPICKY AND NOT A GOOD TEACHER AT ALL. GRADES HARSHLY BUT CAN'T SHOW YOU HOW TO IMPROVE. THE WORKLOAD IS INSANEEE. HAVE TO READ HUNDREDS OF PAGES IN THE TEXTBOOK. SAVE YOURSELF! DON'T EVEN TAKE HER IF IT IS THE LAST PICK, FIND SOMEONE ELSE AND TAKE HISTORY LATER.

AND LOTSSS OF READING. SHE GRADES EXTREMELY TOUGH, HARD TO GET AN A AND I AM A 4.0 STUDENT. DONT LISTEN TO THE OTHER REVIEWS. TOO MANY HOURS PER WEEK SPENT ON THIS CLASS
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: read this review if nothing else. her lectures are extremely dry and boring. she is a tough grader, and very obviously picks favorites in the class. on some assignments she won't even give feedback. her instructions are always vague. the rare times she does give feedback, it is often incorrect or contradicts itself. do not take.
rating_tags: Tough grader--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: She is a very nice professor, but you have to write 4 papers; 2 page, 3 page, 3 page, and 4 page. They are a majority of your grade and are very repetitive, especially because only class sources, like the textbook, are able to be used. Weekly reflections and reading quizzes based on textbook and lectures.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: instead of test there were 4 papers, she was accessible outside of class, the class is lecture heavy and there are reading quizzes every week (5 questions and pretty hard if you don't read). she makes you get in groups each class to discuss different sources.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: I love professor Silke! She is the kindest and most thoughtful professor i have met here at ksu. Lectures and work are interesting and knowledgeable. (Not a huge fan of history, before her!) Easy work: weekly quiz, weekly reflection assignment, and a few papers, with nice topics! She genuinely wants you to pass the class. Take her!!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Attendance is mandatory but you get 3 I excused absences before it affects your grade. She provides very clear rubrics for every assignment. weekly reading quizzes are open note. weekly reflections are not difficult and are graded on a pass/fail basis. There are no tests, but there are 4 papers. She is a very kind teacher though and willing to help
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I loved taking Ms. Silke's class. She was everything I'd hope professors strive to be. No exams in the class because she believes proctorial crosses a line with students privacy. Attendance is mandatory but you get 3 unexcused to play with and if you give her a valid excuse she usually lets it go.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Workload.This class wasn't for me. It was very lecture heavy so I found myself immensely bored. You're going to have to read pages of the textbook every single day to stay on track, which left me prioritizing this class above others. She's sweet and gives great feedback, but if you have a short attention span, I do not recommend taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Zoller isn't the worst professor, just kinda boring. I tune out of class a lot & everything is on d2l. Attendance is mandatory so you kind of have to go to class. There are no test but there are some papers, but they aren't too difficult. There are also weekly open-book quizzes and assignments. They aren't the hardest but it is a lot of work.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: There were no tests only short assignments, essays, and a book review. Read the textbooks and easily pass. Her attendance is mandatory which sucked because her lectures are super dry and boring. It is also apparent for teaching a military that she obliviously is not in-tune with what she is teaching.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Only take her course if you are willing to sit through some pretty dry lectures. She's really nice and cares about your work, but her lectures could use a lot of work for sure. Definitely needs to make them more engaging. But if you pay decent attention in class and don't slack off on your papers, you should at least get a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: Repetitive in learning content but tries to change things up occasionally. Hits on interesting topics and encourages discussion of topics. There is daily participation assignments, a few tests, and a paper. Not a difficult class overall but does not mean you can ignore everything said and pass.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She's a really nice person, but this class was difficult for a 1000 level. She grades weekly discussions and writing assignments pretty strictly, with points being taken off for "filler" and lack of "complexity." The weekly work was manageable, but you will have to work for an A, & even a B if you are not a good writer. No tests. 4 3-page papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Zoller seems like a nice woman, but her class is a total bore. Her public speaking skills are kind of poor and getting people to participate is like pulling teeth. If you are not a good writer, good luck because the papers are worth more than the midterm and final exam, however I did not find her class to be very difficult- attendance mandatory
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Had to read a chapter from the textbook each week along with assignments with it. The chapters can be long but you wont pass if you dont read. It was the same schedule each week with added papers here and there. She is a tough grader but is consistent with how she grades. She responds super quick to emails.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr. Zoller was wonderful. The course was manageable, and all the quizzes, discussions, and assignments were short and easy. She's a tough grader on the four papers, but if you email her rough drafts, she'll give feedback before you have to submit them. Overall, good professor and good class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Tough grader

comment: Professor Zoller was very helpful throughout the semester. She provided lots of feedback on writing assignments. Grades consisted of weekly modules (online because of COVID) that included readings, a quiz, a writing assignment, and a two part discussion board post. She grades the four papers from throughout the semester in a very detailed way.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: The work load for this course was ridiculous. Every week you have a Quiz(wont pass unless you read the textbook), Discussion Post, Response, and a Writing Assignment. She would have a paper, writing assignment and response due on the same day. Grades for grammar more than information. Once behind, hard to catch up. Very hard wouldnt take again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: i dont want to say professor zoller was a bad professor, because her lectures are very informative and comprehensive. my problems with her stem from the absurd amount of work (a quiz, discussion + response, and writing assignment every single week). get the textbook because you do A LOT of reading. overall, the workload is ridiculous.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback
